title: Human oversight for high-risk AI systems

article_refs.quote: High-risk AI systems shall be designed and developed in such a way, including with appropriate human-machine interface tools, that they can be effectively overseen by natural persons during the period in which they are in use.

legal_consequence.verbatim: High-risk AI systems shall be designed and developed in such a way, including with appropriate human-machine interface tools, that they can be effectively overseen by natural persons during the period in which they are in use.

items.label: Oversight purpose and measures
items.text: Oversight aims to prevent or minimise risks, with measures commensurate to risk, autonomy and context, either built into the system or to be implemented by the deployer.

items.label: Capabilities required of overseeing persons
items.text: Enable understanding of system capabilities/limitations, monitoring, avoidance of automation bias, correct interpretation, ability to override/stop operation.

items.label: Annex III 1(a) additional verification
items.text: For remote biometric identification use case, require separate verification by at least two natural persons (unless disproportionate under specified public sector contexts).

items.label: Penalty and enforcement (Article 99)
items.text: Obligation/requirement. Administrative fines up to EUR 15,000,000 or 3% of worldwide turnover (whichever is higher) may apply for nonâ€‘compliance (subject to SME caps and due process).
